parameter.title: Orbit type
parameter.abstract: Define the orbit source for the Orbit Correction. NOTE: Precise orbit is available after 20 days of the data acquisition time.

parameter.title: Azimuth coherence window size
parameter.abstract: Define the coherence estimation azimuth window size for the Interferogram processing [integer number of pixels]

parameter.title: Range coherence window size
parameter.abstract: Define the coherence estimation range window size for the Interferogram processing [integer number of pixels]

parameter.title: DEM type
parameter.abstract: Define the DEM source for the Back-Geocoding Coregistration, Topographic Phase Removal and Terrain Correction processing. NOTE: SRTM valid in the [-56 deg,+60 deg] range of latitudes.

parameter.title: Perform phase filtering
parameter.abstract: Select if the Goldstein phase filtering has to be performed

parameter.title: Azimuth Multilook factor
parameter.abstract: Define the multilook factor applied for Azimuth direction in the Multilooking processing [integer]

parameter.title: Range Multilook factor
parameter.abstract: Define the multilook factor applied for Range direction in the Multilooking processing [integer]

parameter.title: Perform phase unwrapping
parameter.abstract: Select if the phase unwrapping (through SNAPHU) has to be performed

parameter.title: Subset Bounding Box for Unwrapping
parameter.abstract: Define the area of interest for the Phase Unwrapping processing [lon_min,lat_min,lon_max,lat_max].

parameter.title: Bounding Box Size for Unwrapping [deg]
parameter.abstract: Define the square window size around center of bounding box for Phase Unwrapping [degrees]

parameter.title: Pixel spacing in meters
parameter.abstract: Define the pixel spacing for the Terrain-Correction processing [meters]

workflow.title: SNAP Sentinel-1 IW SLC Interferogram and Displacements
workflow.abstract: This service provides the interferometric processor for the Sentinel-1 TOPSAR IW SLC data performed through SNAP. SNAP is a common architecture for all Sentinel Toolboxes, which is ideal for Earth Observation processing and analysis. The tutorial can be found at: https://terradue.github.io/doc-tep-geohazards/tutorials/rss_snap_s1_insar.html
